title-group.article-title: Performance Incentive Fees: An Agency Theoretic Approach

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1987 Graduate School of Business Administration, University of Washington

abstract.p: This paper employs recent developments in agency theory to study the impact that compensation contracts have on portfolio management investment decisions in a restricted mean-variance world. Two types of incentive contracts for mutual fund managers are analyzed and compared. The results show that the "symmetric" contract, while not necessarily eliminating agency costs, dominates the "bonus" contract in aligning the manager's interests with those of the investor.
